name: places/ChIJXaniupxZwokRBEmd2MbZL2Q
formattedAddress: 310 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 310 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cozy location for traditional Indian cuisine, plus live sitar music & free delivery.

originalText.text: A little surprised by the strong reviews here. The food is standard, some things seem fresh and others (like the samosas) seem frozen. My lassi had chunks on the bottom!!! The beer was warm and flat. I'm worried about this place, the staff seem very nice but the food is unsettling. Fried onions was so greasy, butter chicken tasted so sweet and oddly spiced.

text.text: A little surprised by the strong reviews here. The food is standard, some things seem fresh and others (like the samosas) seem frozen. My lassi had chunks on the bottom!!! The beer was warm and flat. I'm worried about this place, the staff seem very nice but the food is unsettling. Fried onions was so greasy, butter chicken tasted so sweet and oddly spiced.

originalText.text: Excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere. I’m so glad we visited! We were greeted directly when we entered and the waiter made us feel cozy and at home. The prices were very affordable and service was fast and efficient. The place has a BYOB possibility but also serves small brewery beers at a cheap price. I had Butter Chicken and it was creamy, delicious and just the perfect amount of ”spicy”. We were also served mango ice cream after our meal as a complementary dish by the restaurant. Highly recommend this place!

text.text: Excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere. I’m so glad we visited! We were greeted directly when we entered and the waiter made us feel cozy and at home. originalText.text:
Lazy service, took forever to bring food when the restaurant was almost empty.
However, good live music.
Food was OK, not close to Indian food.

text.text:
Lazy service, took forever to bring food when the restaurant was almost empty.
However, good live music.
Food was OK, not close to Indian food.

originalText.text: Excellent service and hospitality can be found at this location. The best way to describe TAJ is by telling you that it's like a home cooked meal in a cozy environment without all of the bells, whistles, and sterility found in chain and contemporary restaurants.

text.text: Excellent service and hospitality can be found at this location. The best way to describe TAJ is by telling you that it's like a home cooked meal in a cozy environment without all of the bells, whistles, and sterility found in chain and contemporary restaurants.

originalText.text:
No other Indian food spot compares. I've been coming back to this place since I moved to the city. The prices can't be beat for food that is tasty & filling - I always leave with a full stomach! The family that runs the restaurant is always so welcoming and kind. It's suitable for large gatherings or even dinner for two.
Their live sitar music is so wonderful to enjoy with your meal as well (be sure to bring cash to tip the musicians!)

They've been around for 35 years in the East Village. Show them some love! There's so much richness in this restaurant.
